alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 04 at 11:46PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Colorado, including the following county, Lincoln. * WHEN...Until 115 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1146 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Currie Creek, Hell Creek, North Fork Arikaree River, Dugout Creek and South Fork Republican River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northeastern Lincoln County
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
